alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 3:32PM CDT until April 15 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BALDWIN...SANTA ROSA AND ESCAMBIA COUNTIES... At 330 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Molino to 11 miles north of Lillian to Elberta to 4 miles west of Bon Secour, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 315 PM trained spotter reports winds gusting to 60 to 70 mph near Loxley. A mesonet site near Loxley also reported a 58 mph gust IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gonzalez, Gulf Shores, Foley, Pace, Milton, Gulf Breeze, Orange Beach, Goulding, Bagdad, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Oriole Beach, Bon Secour and Navarre. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
